result.content:
• A simple solution can be as follow :
  • base case of our function at n = 0 is x
  • so if n=1 we will return g^1(x) = f(g^0(x))
  • that equal to f(g^0(x)) = f(x) = Ax+B
  • so if n=2 we will return g^2(x) = f(g^1(x))
  • that equal to f(g^1(x)) = f(Ax+B) = A(Ax+B)+B = A^2*x+AB+B
  • so if n=3 we will return g^3(x) = f(g^2(x))
  • that equal to f(g^2(x)) = f(A^2*x+AB+B) = A(A^2*x+AB+B)+B = A^3*x+A^2*B+AB+B
  • so if n=4 we will return g^4(x) = f(g^3(x))
  • that equal to f(g^3(x)) = f(A^3*x+A^2*B+AB+B) = A(A^3*x+A^2*B+AB+B)+B = A^4*x+A^3*B+A^2*B+AB+B
  • overall :
  • we will return f(g^n(x)) = A^(n)*x+A^(n-1)*B+A^(n-2)*B+...+AB+B
  • first term = A^(n)*x
  • remainder terms = A^(n-1)*B+A^(n-2)*B+...+AB+B
  • we will take B common factor that equation will be
  • B * ( A^(n-1)+A^(n-2)+...+A+1 )
  • we solve it by get summetion of geometry series of n terms by factor A
  • final equation will be : x * power(A,n) + B * summetion of geometry series (A,n)
